alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 10:15AM CDT until July 02 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Cook County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 1015 AM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow-moving, heavy rainfall across the area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen with rain rates of up to 2 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible. HAZARD...Significant flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, low-lying areas, and poor drainage areas. Widespread street and underpass flooding. Possible flooding of structures. Possible flooding of highways. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Hammond, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Lemont, Midway Airport, Austin, West Town, Irving Park, Palos Park, Blue Island, La Grange. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
